experience.aboutWork:
CS 464 Open-Source Software Development 
 o Mentored students by providing a theoretical foundation of history, key concepts, technologies, and practices associated with modern Free and Open-Source Software (FOSS) projects like GenderMag, freeCodeCamp, Sportsipy, react-native. 
 o Assessed coursework, assignments, and held dozubt clarification sessions for students. 
 
CS 290 Web Development. 
 o Guided students in developing modern web applications using technologies such as Java Script, React, NodeJS, ExpressJS and MongoDB, and evaluating architectural strategies with particular emphasis on Scalability, Usability, and Security.

o Identified malicious threats & resolved Security Issues of given problem statement using behavioral patterns through AI.
 o Accomplished requirements to be recognized as XVigil Professional, a SaaS based digital risk monitoring platform.

education.degree: Master of Science in Computer Science
education.coursework: Coursework: Software Engineering Methods, Human-Computer Interaction, DBMS, Computer Graphics
Coursework: Software Engineering, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Machine Learning, Big Data.

projects.name: LEA & Judiciary Interactive Case Management System
projects.details:
o Designed an interactive web application to allow authorized users to log in, file cases, and host meetings efficiently using ExpressJS and MongoDB.
o Developed a video conferencing platform for enlisted applicants with WebRTC.

projects.name: Between Subject Lab Study - Figma Vs Framer
projects.details:
o Conducted a lab study on 30 users and compared effectiveness, efficiency, and usability of designing prototypes.
o Achieved significant results by performing statistical analysis on acquired data from participants.

projects.name: Offline Hand-Written Text Image Recognition using Deep Learning
projects.details:
o Implemented CNN Algorithm to classify and recognize hand-written text images.
o Built User Interface using Flask to allow users to upload hand-written text images.

projects.name: React-Native Multiplatform Application
projects.details: o Curated geographical and travel information using React-Native and published into Expo CLI.

interests.paragraph: EECS Graduate Student Association - Event Coordinator
interests.duty: o Maintained consistent communication with the professors and demonstrated responsibility in conducting technical and non-technical events successfully.
